metadata.title: CVE-2012-6707 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.description:
WordPress through 4.8.2 uses a weak MD5-based password hashing algorithm, which makes it easier for attackers to determine cleartext values by leveraging access to the hash values. NOTE: the approach to changing this may not be fully compatible with certain use cases, such as migration of a WordPress site from a web host that uses a recent PHP version to a different web host that uses PHP 5.2. These use cases are plausible (but very unlikely) based on statistics showing widespread deployment of WordPress with obsolete PHP versions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6707` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.9.7+dfsg1-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.9.7+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 4.9.7+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 4.9.7+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentytwo - 4.9.7+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.9.7+dfsg1-1').
